Method Detail

getDocument

public static org.dom4j.Document getDocument(java.lang.Object record)
                                      throws RecordFormatException
Get a dom4j Document from a record. Valid records may contain an XML String,a Dom4j Document, or null If not, a RecordFormatException will be thrown. Note that if a null input record is supplied, null will be returned. //ToDo: Agreee null behaviour with rest of openadaptor team

Parameters:
record -
Returns:
Document possibly having generated it from an XML String
Throws:
RecordFormatException

getTypedValue

public static java.lang.Object getTypedValue(org.dom4j.Element element,
                                             java.lang.String typeAttributeName,
                                             boolean useTagName)
                                      throws RecordFormatException
Return a Java object given an element's text value (or tag name) If typeAttributeName is not null, and that attribute is specified, then it will use the value to determine the Object to return. If typeAttributeName is null, or the attribute is not set, then the String value of the element is returned. Currently it supports the following mappings:
  • Double yields java.lang.Double
  • Long yields java.lang.Long
  • String yields java.lang.String
If unable to generate the appropriate class (e.g. if it failed to parse a number, or date), a RecordFormatException will be thrown.

Parameters:
element - Element whose text value, (or tag) is being typed
typeAttributeName - (optional) name of attribute which contains type value
Returns:
Object containing a String,Date,Long or Double value.
Throws:
RecordFormatException - if unable to create appropriate Object from the value.

asTypedValue

public static final java.lang.Object asTypedValue(java.lang.String value,
                                                  java.lang.String type)
                                           throws RecordFormatException
Return the supplied String value as a java Object given the requested type. //ToDo: Probably better to make this factory based, and allow user-specified ones also.

Parameters:
value - String value
type - one of Double,Long,Date,String or null.
Returns:
one of java.lang.String (default), java.lang.Double,java.lang.Long, java.util.Date
Throws:
RecordFormatException - If an unrecognised type is specified, or conversion isn't possible

valueAsNonNullString

public static final java.lang.String valueAsNonNullString(java.lang.Object object)
Return a (non-null) String representation of supplied Object.
  • If object is null, returns empty String ("").
  • If object is a String, it returns it cast to String.
  • Otherwise it returns object.toString().

Parameters:
object -
Returns:
String representation of input value, or empty String if input is null.
